intro: Canthium barbatum f. rurutu, commonly known as the Rurutu canthium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the island of Rurutu in the Society Islands of French Polynesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture. This species is adapted to the tropical climate and is typically found in moist, shaded environments.
